dcterms:description: The BABEL speech corpus is primarily composed of conversational telephone speech (CTS) along with some scripted recordings and far field recordings, used for training and evaluation in multilingual automatic speech recognition.
dcterms:title: BABEL speech corpus

dcterms:creator: Martin Karaﬁ´at

Karel Vesel`y
Frantiˇsek Gr´ezl
Jan ˇCernocky
dcterms:description: The BABEL languages dataset includes data from 10 languages used for training a multilingual sequence-to-sequence model, facilitating transfer learning to other languages.
dcterms:title: BABEL languages (10 languages used for multilingual seq2seq model)

dcterms:creator: Martin Karaﬁ´at

dcterms:description: Assamese language data is part of the BABEL dataset, used for training and evaluating speech recognition models.
dcterms:title: Assamese language data

dcterms:creator: Martin Karaﬁ´at

dcterms:description: Other BABEL languages include a variety of languages such as Cantonese, Bengali, Pashto, Turkish, Vietnamese, Haitian, Tamil, Kurdish, Tokpisin, Georgian, Assamese, Tagalog, Swahili, and Lao, used for multilingual speech recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: Other BABEL languages
